    • Method Detail

      • getTokenizer

        public Tokenizer getTokenizer()
        Returns this Parser's Tokenizer. Should be used only for testing this Parser; external use of the Tokenizer will change its state and invalidate this Parser.
        Returns:
        This Parser's Tokenizer.

      • isProgram

        public boolean isProgram()
        Tries to parse a <program>. 
        <program> ::= <command> { <command> } { <procedure> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the sequence specified above is not followed.
        Returns:
        true if a <program> is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isProcedure

        public boolean isProcedure()
        Tries to parse a <procedure>. 
        <procedure> ::= "def" <name> { <variable> } <block>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if "def" is present but the sequence specified above is not followed.
        Returns:
        true if a <procedure> is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isCommand

        public boolean isCommand()
        Tries to parse a <command>. 
         <command> ::= <move> <expression> <eol> |
 "penup" <eol> | "pendown" <eol> | <color> <eol> |
 "home" <eol> | "jump" <expression> <expression> <eol> |
 "set" <variable> <expression> <eol> |
 "repeat" <expression> <block> | "while" <condition> <block> |
 "if" <condition> <block> [ "else" <block> ] |
 "do" <name> { <expression> } <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the sequence specified above is not followed.
        Returns:
        true if a <command> is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs If an I/O error occurs

      • isMove

        public boolean isMove()
        Tries to parse a <move>. 
        <move> ::= "forward" | "right" | "left" | "face"
        Returns:
        true if a <move> is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs If an I/O error occurs

      • isColor

        public boolean isColor()
        Tries to parse a <color>. 
        <color> ::= "red" | "orange" | "yellow" | "green" | "cyan" | "blue" |
 "purple" | "magenta" | "pink" | "olive" | "black" | "gray" | "white" | "brown" | "tan"|
 "color" <expression> <expression> <expression>"
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if "color" is not followed by three consecutive <expression>.
        Returns:
        true if a <color> is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs If an I/O error occurs
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isBlock

        public boolean isBlock()
        Tries to parse a <block>. 
        <block> ::= "{" <eol> { <command> } "}" <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if an "{" is present but the sequence specified above is not followed.
        Returns:
        true if a <block> is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isCondition

        public boolean isCondition()
        Tries to parse a <condition>. 
        <condition> ::= <expression> <comparator> <expression>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if an <expression> is present but is not followed by a <comparator> and thereafter another <expression>.
        Returns:
        true if a <condition> is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isExpression

        public boolean isExpression()
        Tries to parse an <expression>. 
        <expression> ::= [ <add_operator> ] <term> { <add_operator> <unsignedTerm> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the add_operator is present but not followed by a valid <expression>.
        Returns:
        true if an expression is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isTerm

        public boolean isTerm()
        Tries to parse a <term>. 
        <term> ::= <factor> { <multiply_operator> <factor> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the multiply_operator is present but not followed by a valid <term>.
        Returns:
        true if a term is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isUnsignedTerm

        public boolean isUnsignedTerm()
        Tries to parse an <unsignedTerm>. 
        <unsignedTerm> ::= <unsignedFactor> { <multiply_operator> <factor> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the multiply_operator is present but not followed by a valid <term>.
        Returns:
        true if an unsignedTerm is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isUnsignedFactor

        public boolean isUnsignedFactor()
        Tries to parse an <unsignedFactor>. 
        <unsignedFactor> ::= <variable>
                   | <number>
                   | "(" <expression> ")"
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the opening parenthesis is present but not followed by a valid <expression> and a closing parenthesis.
        Returns:
        true if an unsignedFactor is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isFactor

        public boolean isFactor()
        Tries to parse a <factor>. 
        <factor> ::= [ <addOperator> ] <unsignedFactor>
        Returns:
        true if a factor is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isComparator

        public boolean isComparator()
        Tries to parse a <comparator>. 
        <comparator> ::= "<" | "=" | ">"
        Returns:
        true if a <comparator> is recognized.

        Returns:
        true if an addop is recognized.

        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

        public boolean isVariable()
        Tries to parse a <variable>, which is just a "name".
        Returns:
        true if a variable is recognized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isEol

        public boolean isEol()
        Tries to parse an <eol>. 
        <eol> ::= <newline> { <newline> }
        Returns:
        true if an <eol> is recognized.

      • isNumber

        private boolean isNumber()
        Tests whether the next Token is a number. If it is, the Token is consumed, otherwise it is not.
        Returns:
        true if the next Token is a number.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isName

        private boolean isName()
        Tests whether the next Token is a name. If it is, the Token is consumed, otherwise it is not.
        Returns:
        true if the next Token is a name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isName

        private boolean isName(java.lang.String expectedName)
        Tests whether the next Token is the expected name. If it is, the Token is consumed, otherwise it is not.
        Parameters:
        expectedName - The String value of the expected next Token.
        Returns:
        true if the next Token is a name with the expected value.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isKeyword

        private boolean isKeyword(java.lang.String expectedName)
        Tests whether the next Token is the expected keyword. If it is, the Token is consumed, otherwise it is not.
        Parameters:
        expectedName - The String value of the expected next Token.
        Returns:
        true if the next Token is a name with the expected value.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isSymbol

        private boolean isSymbol(java.lang.String expectedSymbol)
        Tests whether the next Token is the expected symbol. If it is, the Token is consumed, otherwise it is not.
        Parameters:
        expectedSymbol - The expected symbol.
        Returns:
        true if the next Token is the expected symbol.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • isPenup

        private boolean isPenup()
        Tries to parse a sequence headed by "penup";. 
        "penup" <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if a "penup" is present but is not followed by <eol>.
        Returns:
        true if a penup sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

        Returns:
        true if a pendown sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

        Returns:
        true if a home sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isJump

        private boolean isJump()
        Tries to parse a sequence headed by "jump";. 
        "jump" <expression> <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if a "jump" is present but is not followed by two <expression>s and a <eol>.
        Returns:
        true if a jump sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isSet

        private boolean isSet()
        Tries to parse a sequence headed by "set";. 
        "set" <variable> <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if a "set" is present but is not followed by a <variable>, a <expression>, and a <eol>.
        Returns:
        true if a set sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isRepeat

        private boolean isRepeat()
        Tries to parse a sequence headed by "repeat";. 
        "repeat" <expression> <block>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if a "repeat" is present but is not followed by a <expression> and a <block>.
        Returns:
        true if a repeat sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isWhile

        private boolean isWhile()
        Tries to parse a sequence headed by "while";. 
        "while" <condition> <block>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if a "while" is present but is not followed by a <condition> and a <block>.
        Returns:
        true if a while sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isIf

        private boolean isIf()
        Tries to parse a sequence headed by "if";. 
        "if" <condition> <block> [ "else" <block> ]
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if an "if" is present but is not followed by the sequence specified above.
        Returns:
        true if an if sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • isDo

        private boolean isDo()
        Tries to parse a sequence headed by "do";. 
        "do" <name> { <expression> } <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if an "do" is present but is not followed by the sequence specified above.
        Returns:
        true if a do sequence is recognized.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - If syntax error is detected

      • makeRootDesignatedTree

        private void makeRootDesignatedTree(java.lang.String root,
                          int numOfLeaves)
        Pushes a new Tree with designated root onto the stack. If there are leaf elements on the stack, those are added to the root prior to the Tree's being pushed.
        Parameters:
        root - value of the Token(value) of the Tree
        numOfLeaves - Number of leaves to add to the list Tree

      • nextTokenMatches

        private boolean nextTokenMatches(TokenType type)
        If the next Token has the expected type, it is used as the value of a new (childless) Tree node, and that node is then pushed onto the stack. If the next Token does not have the expected type, this method effectively does nothing.
        Parameters:
        type - The expected type of the next Token.
        Returns:
        true if the next Token has the expected type.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • nextTokenMatches

        private boolean nextTokenMatches(TokenType type,
                       java.lang.String value)
        If the next Token has the expected type and value, it is used as the value of a new (childless) Tree node, and that node is then pushed onto the stack; otherwise, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        type - The expected type of the next Token.
        value - The expected value of the next Token; must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if the next Token has the expected type.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • makeTree

        private void makeTree(int rootIndex,
            int... childIndices)
        Assembles some number of elements from the top of the global stack into a new Tree, and replaces those elements with the new Tree.

        Caution: The arguments must be consecutive integers 1..N, in any order, but with no gaps; for example, makeTree(2,4,1,5) would cause problems (3 was omitted).

        Example: If the stack contains

         1  |  A  |                                     |    B    |       
 2  |  B  |                                     |   / \   |
 3  |  C  |  then makeTree(2, 3, 1) results in  |  C   A  |
    | ... |                                     |   ...   |
    |_____|                                     |_________|
        Parameters:
        rootIndex - Which stack element (counting from top=1) to use as the root of the new Tree.
        childIndices - Which stack elements to use as the children of the root.

      • getStackItem

        private Tree<Token> getStackItem(int n)
        Returns, as a Tree, the nth element from the top of the instance variable stack (the top element is 1).
        Parameters:
        n - Which element of the stack, counting 1 as the top element, to return.
        Returns:
        The indicated stack element.

      • error

        private void error(java.lang.String message)
        Utility routine to throw a SyntaxException with the given message.
        Parameters:
        message - The text to put in the SyntaxException.
